title: Learner-Centered Technology Integration Instructional Design in Early Childhood Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational early childhood education theories and general experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: A program for in-service practitioners focusing on analyzing technology integration cases in early childhood education, strengthening instructional design competencies that reflect learner needs. Includes hands-on practice with collaboration tools and educational apps in BYOD environments.

learning_goals: They can explain criteria for selecting digital tools aligned with educational goals by analyzing early childhood learnersâ€™ developmental stages and technology needs.
They can apply a process to evaluate the pedagogical validity of technology-integrated activities through learner-centered instructional design.
They can propose at least three practical strategies to address educational issues arising from interactions between young children, teachers, and technology.

resources: Digital Content Samples for Early Childhood Education
